Rulings.Edison:
●You can use the effect of Gravekeeper’s Chief to Special Summon the same monster you Tributed to Summon Gravekeeper’s Chief.
●If you Set, Flip Summon, or Special Summon Gravekeeper’s Chief, its Special Summoning effect is not activated.
●If you have Gravekeeper’s Chief and Necrovalley on the field, you can use Monster Reborn, Premature Burial, Call of the Haunted, etc. to revive monsters from your GY. Also, if you have Gravekeeper's Chief on the field, your opponent can use Monster Reborn on monsters in your GY.
●You can't activate The Shallow Grave while Necrovalley is active, even if you control Gravekeeper’s Chief, because your opponent can't Special Summon a monster from his GY.
●If Necrovalley is on the field, and both players control a Gravekeeper’s Chief, then the Flip Effect of Fiber Jar can resolve normally, but if neither, or only 1, player has Gravekeeper’s Chief, then the Flip Effect of Fiber Jar disappears.

Rulings.Goat:
●You can use the effect of Gravekeeper’s Chief to Special Summon the same monster you Tributed to Summon Gravekeeper’s Chief.
●If you Set, Flip Summon, or Special Summon Gravekeeper’s Chief, its Special Summoning effect is not activated.
●If you have Gravekeeper’s Chief and Necrovalley on the field, you can use Monster Reborn, Premature Burial, Call of the Haunted, etc. to revive monsters from your GY. Also, if you have Gravekeeper's Chief on the field, your opponent can use Monster Reborn on monsters in your GY.
●You cannot activate The Shallow Grave while Necrovalley is applying, even if you control Gravekeeper’s Chief, because your opponent cannot Special Summon a monster from his GY.
●If Necrovalley is on the field, and both players control a Gravekeeper’s Chief, then the Flip Effect of Fiber Jar can resolve normally, but if neither, or only 1, player has Gravekeeper’s Chief, then the Flip Effect of Fiber Jar disappears.
●Q: If “Gravekeeper's Chief” is on the field and so is” Necrovalley,” is the controller of “Gravekeeper’s Chief” allowed to play cards with effects that target his/her GY? (“Monster Reborn,” “Call of the Haunted,” etc) 
A: The GY of a person controlling a Face-Up “Gravekeeper's Chief” is not affected by “Necrovalley.” Either player would be able to use card effects that would involve the GY of the player controlling the “Gravekeeper's Chief.” So if I have “Gravekeeper's Chief” face-up on my side of the field, my opponent could use “Monster Reborn” on a monster in my GY, but not their own GY. I could also use “Monster Reborn” on a monster in my GY, but not my opponent's GY.   
●Q: If there are 2 “Gravekeeper’s Chief” on one side of the field while “Skill Drain” is applying and “Mystical Space Typhoon” targets “Skill Drain” what happens? 
A: After the Chain resolves you will have to choose one of the two “Gravekeeper's Chiefs” and send it to the GY.  12 /15 /2003

Rulings.Base:
1. You can use the effect of "Gravekeeper's Chief" to Special Summon the same monster you Tributed to Summon "Gravekeeper's Chief".
2. If you Set, Flip Summon, or Special Summon "Gravekeeper's Chief", its Special Summoning effect is not activated.
3. If you have "Gravekeeper's Chief" and "Necrovalley" on the field, you can use "Monster Reborn", "Premature Burial", "Call of the Haunted", etc. to revive monsters from your GY. Also, if you have "Gravekeeper's Chief" on the field, your opponent can use "Monster Reborn" on monsters in your GY.
4. You cannot activate "The Shallow Grave" while "Necrovalley" is active, even if you control "Gravekeeper's Chief", because your opponent cannot Special Summon a monster from his GY.
5. If "Necrovalley" is on the field, and both players control a "Gravekeeper's Chief", then the Flip Effect of "Fiber Jar" can resolve normally, but if neither, or only 1, player has "Gravekeeper's Chief", then the Flip Effect of "Fiber Jar" disappears.
